TopicTitle: Wings inside fairnings do not function correctly aftrer fairing deployment.

Articles.Content:
Description:  I built a glider, and placed it atop a rocket inside a fairing.  After deploying the fairing, the wings and control surfaces did not provide lift correctly, and some of the wings/control surfaces did not function at all.  Launching the assembly without a fairing eliminated the bug.

KSP Version: 0.1.2.0.

OS: Win11

CPU/GPU:  I9, RTX4070

Expected Behavior:  After deploying the fairing I expect the wings and control surfaces to function correctly.

Observed Behavior:  After deploying the fairing, some of the wings and control surfaces did not function correctly.  Seemed like roughly half the wings or control surfaces did not function, causing severe roll issues with the plane.  It seemed like half the wings/control surfaces were not even there, the plane rolled severely with even minor lift being applied.  

The glider flew perfectly fine when it was launched atop a rocket with no fairings.  It flew bizarrely when launched atop a rocket with fairings protecting the glider.

Steps to replicate:

  • Build a simple glider, launch it atop a simple rocket without any fairings.  Should work fine.
  • With the exact same rocket/glider assembly, build the fairing to enclose the glider.  See if it flies correctly.

No known fixes/workarounds at this time.

I am not using any mods.
